intro: Hieracium humidiceps, commonly known as the wetland hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy environments in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing yellow petals that attract various pollinators. Hieracium humidiceps is adapted to moist soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
